article_text:
Barter, handouts and hustling used to estimate income

Feds pay premiums, but homeless are left with $5,000 deductible

N.C. Department of Insurance still reviewing

article_metadata.news-keywords: homeless, insurance, affordable, care, act, aca, obamacare, aetna, will kennedy, urban ministry, north carolina, NC
article_metadata.description: Aetna is ending its relationship with a Charlotte insurance agent who used the Affordable Care Act to sell premium-free policies to hundreds of homeless people while the N.C. Department of Insurance continues its review of the arrangement.
article_metadata.title: Aetna breaks ties to man who sold policies to hundreds of homeless | The Charlotte Observer
